channel.title: Reflection help
channel.description:
Hi,
I went learn reflection so I have 2 questions:
[ul][li]How to get the hook (like ab.cd)?[/li] [li]How can I get a npc position, level, object, item... whit the hook?[/li][/ul]
thanx
Gabuuzz
note: I have search in the forum, but not find a tutorial for reflection.

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“gabuuzz, post:34, topic:224319”][quote author=shangtsung1 link=topic=294687.msg2380610#msg2380610 date=1218552167]
Reflection requires no edits too the client

to get values out of the client using reflection
you get the class loader, invoke the class, get the field and then use the getInt(Object o) method on the field

public Field someField = getField("ab", "cd");

    public Field getField(String clazz, String field) {
        try {
            System.out.println("looking for class " + clazz + " and field " + field);
            Class clazzObj = (Class) rsLoader.loadClass.invoke(rsLoader, clazz, false);
            Field fieldObj = clazzObj.getDeclaredField(field);
            fieldObj.setAccessible(true);
            return fieldObj;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Error - Class: " + clazz + "; Field: " + field);
            e.printStackTrace();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public int getSomeFieldIntValue(){
        try {
            return someField.getInt(null);
        } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
            return -1;
        }
    }

err hope this helped

EDIT:
if the field is in a object you do getInt(OBJECT_HERE);
[/quote]
My script work now.
I have change “127.0.0.1” by “url.getWorldURL()” …Bcel is so nice .[/quote]bcel isnt reflection

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

[quote=“shangtsung1, post:32, topic:224319”]Reflection requires no edits too the client

to get values out of the client using reflection
you get the class loader, invoke the class, get the field and then use the getInt(Object o) method on the field

public Field someField = getField("ab", "cd");

    public Field getField(String clazz, String field) {
        try {
            System.out.println("looking for class " + clazz + " and field " + field);
            Class clazzObj = (Class) rsLoader.loadClass.invoke(rsLoader, clazz, false);
            Field fieldObj = clazzObj.getDeclaredField(field);
            fieldObj.setAccessible(true);
            return fieldObj;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Error - Class: " + clazz + "; Field: " + field);
            e.printStackTrace();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public int getSomeFieldIntValue(){
        try {
            return someField.getInt(null);
        } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
            return -1;
        }
    }

err hope this helped

EDIT:
if the field is in a object you do getInt(OBJECT_HERE);[/quote]
My script work now.
I have change “127.0.0.1” by “url.getWorldURL()” …Bcel is so nice .

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“shangtsung1, post:32, topic:224319”]Reflection requires no edits too the client

to get values out of the client using reflection
you get the class loader, invoke the class, get the field and then use the getInt(Object o) method on the field

public Field someField = getField("ab", "cd");

    public Field getField(String clazz, String field) {
        try {
            System.out.println("looking for class " + clazz + " and field " + field);
            Class clazzObj = (Class) rsLoader.loadClass.invoke(rsLoader, clazz, false);
            Field fieldObj = clazzObj.getDeclaredField(field);
            fieldObj.setAccessible(true);
            return fieldObj;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Error - Class: " + clazz + "; Field: " + field);
            e.printStackTrace();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public int getSomeFieldIntValue(){
        try {
            return someField.getInt(null);
        } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
            return -1;
        }
    }

err hope this helped

EDIT:
if the field is in a object you do getInt(OBJECT_HERE);[/quote]

You can’t reinvoke the class everytime you needs it’s Field value. You need to use pre-instantiated classes to get the current Field instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @shangtsung1 shangtsung1
item.description:
@shangtsung1 wrote:

Reflection requires no edits too the client

to get values out of the client using reflection
you get the class loader, invoke the class, get the field and then use the getInt(Object o) method on the field

public Field someField = getField("ab", "cd");

    public Field getField(String clazz, String field) {
        try {
            System.out.println("looking for class " + clazz + " and field " + field);
            Class clazzObj = (Class) rsLoader.loadClass.invoke(rsLoader, clazz, false);
            Field fieldObj = clazzObj.getDeclaredField(field);
            fieldObj.setAccessible(true);
            return fieldObj;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("Error - Class: " + clazz + "; Field: " + field);
            e.printStackTrace();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public int getSomeFieldIntValue(){
        try {
            return someField.getInt(null);
        } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
            return -1;
        }
    }

err hope this helped

EDIT:
if the field is in a object you do getInt(OBJECT_HERE);

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

i have try for start to remplace “127.0.0.1” in client.class by url.getWorldURL()
but I have get an error in my method who return a ClassGen[]
the code:

public static ClassGen[] getAllCG() { File f = new File(".\\runescape"); int n=0; for(String file : f.list()){ if(!new File(file).isDirectory()){ n++; } } ClassGen[] cg = new ClassGen[n]; for(int i=0; i<cg.length; i++){ try{ cg[i] = new ClassGen(new ClassParser(f.getName() + "\\" + f.list()[i]).parse()); }catch(Exception e){ e.printStackTrace(); } } return cg; }
the error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException at main.getAllCG(main.java:66) at main.changeURL(main.java:18) at main.main(main.java:14)
[s]the error is the first “for” (I have put runescape directory at the same of the class)

Netbean(my editor) give me the error only when I run …

Note: I know I don’t need to load all the class, but I will use the method for oder thing…[/s]

EDIT: I have found the error only change “.\runescape” by “runescape” and work perfect!

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“gabuuzz, post:24, topic:224319”]thanx the bank(I was see it on rsmonkey)

[quote author=Tree link=topic=294687.msg2371448#msg2371448 date=1218244712]
@gabuuz: I don’t think you are understanding it all correctly.[/quote]
correct me please:
For use relection we need to deob the client and find the fields who give the information you went(idk how to do…) and inject a method who return the field.

Is it correct?[/quote]What you are thinginf of is bytecode injecting and loading a modified client.

Take a look at RSBot, as it should help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection help
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“gabuuzz, post:24, topic:224319”]thanx the bank(I was see it on rsmonkey)

[quote author=Tree link=topic=294687.msg2371448#msg2371448 date=1218244712]
@gabuuz: I don’t think you are understanding it all correctly.[/quote]
correct me please:
For use relection we need to deob the client and find the fields who give the information you went(idk how to do…) and inject a method who return the field.

Is it correct?[/quote]
No, basicly:
For reflection, you need to deob (well it’s easier) the client to find the fields by reading code and debugging.
Then you search this field in an orginal runescape jar (so go from Class61.anInt333 to a.b) and then you have you bot reflect this field.
(Reflection means you access a field, without having a reference to it on compile time.)

Read full topic
